title: 3 typefaces to ID
content:
Can anyone help? I love the elegance of all of them and the serif has a really humble feel. I'm trying to avoid using Minion Pro, so perhaps this could be a good solution. Other recommendations welcome :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [photo (1).JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/typophile.com/files/photo%20(1)_1.JPG) | 334.55 KB |
| [photo (2).JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/typophile.com/files/photo%20(2)_1.JPG) | 390.86 KB |
| [photo (3).JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/typophile.com/files/photo%20(3)_0.JPG) | 378.96 KB |
author: saz86

comments.content:
photo (2): possibly [Akkurat](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Akkurat) Light  
photo (3): may be [FF Milo](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/milo)
Akira is right. This is Fedra Sans Alt. Funny because, I instantly thought about Fedra Sans but totally forgot the alternate version.

Photo (1) shows [Adobe Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/garamond/), photo (2) shows [Akkurat](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Akkurat/). I was not able to classify the third typeface.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/garamond/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/garamond/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/garamond/")  
 [http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Akkurat/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816235658/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Akkurat/ "http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Akkurat/")
